item.title: bash one liner
item.description: 08:32 Tuesday 25 April 2017 JST I sent this to Fred yesterday: I often type `gits` to get the status of git. There is one directory on my filesystem that has a filename starting with 0x0x which I must not commit to git, but I need to see each time I get git status. I wrote this alias gits='git status; if [[ -f 0x0x* ]]; then echo; ls -1 0x0x*; fi' And it works to *not* complain if there is no 0x0x* file, but does not show the file if it is present.
